alert.note: Alert for Johnston; Lee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 3:52AM EST until December 20 at 1:24AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Cumberland, Durham, Harnett, Hoke, Johnston, Lee, Sampson, Scotland and Wake. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is still possible in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 338 AM EST, Rain in the advisory area has ended. Runoff and lingering high water from heavy rain on Sunday and Sunday night continues resulting streams and creeks that are running high with some localized flooding. - Some locations most at risk include locations near Crabtree, Walnut and Swift Creeks in Wake County, tributaries of the Haw River in Chatham County, Beaver and Lockfish Creeks in Cumberland County, Contentnea Creek and Hominy Swamp in Wilson County, Stoney Creek in Wayne County, along with Six Runs Creek and Tributaries of the Black River in Sampson County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
